Copper is an API Key based integration and does not require the setup of an app. ​ Required Credentials of a Linked Account To successfully connect with the Copper integration, a Linked Account or an end-user will need to provide the following to connect: API Key Email Address To understand how a Linked Account can get the above mentioned credentials, refer below. ​ Getting Credentials of Copper To acquire the required credentials and connect a Linked Account, please follow the steps mentioned below: Log in to your Copper account . Click on the Settings button in the side menu > Choose Integrations and select API Keys . Click on Generate API Key and copy the API Key and the Email present in the Creator field of the API. The Linked Account or end-user now have all the credentials required to connect with Copper. ​ Actions and triggers In Cobalt, you can create orchestrations of your use-cases using Copper actions and triggers. Following are the set of Copper actions and triggers supported by Cobalt. Actions Triggers Company Create Company - Create a new company in Copper. Update Company - Update a company in Copper. Delete Company - Delete a company in Copper. Lead Create Lead - Create a new lead in Copper. Update Lead - Update a lead in Copper. Delete Lead - Delete a Lead in Copper. Opportunity Create Opportunity - Create a new opportunity in Copper. Update Opportunity - Update an opportunity in Copper. Delete Opportunity - Delete an opportunity in Copper. Person Create Person - Create a new person in Copper. Update Person - Update a person in Copper. Delete Person - Delete a person in Copper. Others HTTP Request - Make HTTP API calls to any Copper documented REST APIs.
